title: Saudi astronauts, including nation's 1st woman, catch a SpaceX flight to space station
description: Saudi Arabia's first astronauts in decades rocketed toward the International Space Station on a chartered multimillion-dollar flight. The crew will spend just over a week there before returning home.

title: Daniel Penny says he felt no shame after the NYC subway death of Jordan Neely
description: Daniel Penny broke his silence this weekend — insisting that the confrontation between him and Neely "had nothing to do with race," and he was "not a white supremacist."

title: An Indiana man is dead after a grenade found in a grandfather's belongings exploded
description: The man's two children — a 14-year-old boy and an 18-year-old woman — were wounded by shrapnel and transported to a nearby hospital.

title: Canadian wildfire smoke is prompting air quality warnings in the western U.S.
description: Thick plumes of smoke from blazes in the Canadian province of Alberta crossed into nearby states including Montana, Colorado, Idaho and Utah.

title: Ukraine secured military aid, including advanced fighter jets, at the G-7 summit
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy made a rare and brief trip to Hiroshima, Japan this weekend to re-energize support for the war from key Western allies.

title: Both sides are blaming each other for the impasse as a debt limit deadline approaches
description: Negotiations over a deal to increase the United States' debt limit appear to have faltered to the point that the Biden administration and House Republicans are blaming the other side for the impasse.

title: The next show you watch could be filmed in Mexico City
description: American and European companies are increasingly having their commercials, shows and films shot in Mexico, taking advantage of lower costs and experienced Mexican crews.

title: A South African choir sang for Queen Victoria. They had great highs — and awful lows
description: The singers traveled to England for a tour to raise money to build a technical college. Their story is receiving renewed attention because of a new dance performance based on the concert tour.

title: Two missing men, one deputy, zero charged. Join us on a pursuit for answers
description: The podcast The Last Ride examines systemic problems in media and policing and illuminates the deep wounds that are left when no one is held accountable.

title: Japan's atomic bomb survivors hope G-7 firms up support for nuclear disarmament
description: As President Biden and Group of Seven leaders gathered in Hiroshima, people in Japan wanted the setting to act as a powerful symbol for consensus toward banning nuclear arms.

title: The U.S. is expanding CO2 pipelines. One poisoned town wants you to know its story
description: Companies are building carbon dioxide pipelines as a possible climate solution. But after a pipeline rupture sent dozens to the hospital in a Mississippi town, there are questions about their safety.

title: Federal inquiry details abuses of power by Trump's CEO over Voice of America
description: Investigators found Trump's appointee at the U.S. Agency for Global Media repeatedly abused his power. "It just takes one's breath away," says David Seide, a lawyer who represented whistleblowers.

title: Here's what could happen in markets if the U.S. defaults. Hint: It won't be pretty
description: Investors are still hopeful that lawmakers will clinch a deal to raise or suspend the debt ceiling. That's because failure to do so could have devastating consequences in markets.

title: President Zelenskyy has said that Bakhmut is destroyed as Russia claims victory there
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Sunday that Bakhmut was "only in our hearts," hours after Russia's defense ministry reported that their forces had seized the city in eastern Ukraine.

title: At least twelve people have died in a stampede at a soccer stadium in El Salvador
description: At least twelve people were killed and dozens more injured when stampeding soccer fans pushed through one of the access gates at a quarterfinal match in the Salvadoran league Saturday.

title: Warring factions in Sudan agree to temporary ceasefire, U.S. and Saudi mediators say
description: The Sudanese army and the Rapid Support Forces signed off on a seven-day ceasefire that is due to take effect Monday evening, the U.S. and Saudi Arabia said in a joint statement.

title: National Treasure wins the Preakness in a Triple Crown clouded by horse deaths
description: The Bob Baffert-trained horse won the second leg of the Triple Crown at the Pimlico Race Course in Baltimore, while a string of recent horse deaths have clouded this year's races.
